task_summary: The robot must reach and grasp a towel placed on the workspace in front of it, proceeding through detection, approach, alignment, and grasp phases, as visually evidenced in the 9 frames.

task_long_description.overview: A bimanual robot manipulator is tasked to reach toward a towel positioned on a workspace. The process involves visually detecting the towel, approaching above it, aligning precisely, lowering until contact, and closing the gripper to effect a grasp. The sequence strictly follows visual evidence from the frames, with clear arm approach and attempt to grasp the towel, matching the task instruction. Pre- and post-conditions include clear workspace, grasp-ready towel, and unobstructed path.
preconditions: Towel placed flat and visible on workspace
Robot gripper open and free of objects
No obstacles between robot and towel
stepwise_plan: Open gripper in preparation for grasp
Move to a position above the towel
Align TCP with towel for grasp
Lower toward towel until contact detected
Close gripper and attempt to grasp towel
Verify that towel is successfully in gripper
success_criteria: Gripper has stable grasp on towel
Towel lifted or held by gripper
failure_and_recovery: Towel not visible: attempt detection again
Contact not detected: re-align and lower again
Grasp fails: re-open gripper and retry approach
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates when towel is held securely in the robot's gripper or a failure condition is reached and cannot be recovered from.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is visible in the workspace.
Actively detects the towel with perception module.
Opens gripper to a width suitable for grasping the towel.
Moves gripper to a position above the towel.
Aligns the gripper with the towel with tight tolerance.
Lowers gripper towards towel until contact is detected.
Closes the gripper to grasp the towel with moderate force.
Checks if the towel is held by the gripper.

failure_modes: Robot fails to reach above towel
Gripper fails to close or hold towel
assumptions: Contact sheet frames reveal only reaching and initial grasp attempt, no post-grasp manipulation or transfer.
Instruction aligns with frames; reaching interpreted as moving to and grasping the towel.
No evidence of towel placement or post-grasp transfer, so BT terminates after grasp verification.

expected_success_criteria: Towel is securely in the robot's gripper after sequence
Task step completion matches phases in contact sheet frames
